oai_dc:dc.dc:title: People, Place and Participation. Bringing Together Organic and Place - insights from Austria and the US
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bingen, Jim
Freyer, Bernhard
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Networks and ownership
Policy environments and social economy
Quality and evaluation of inputs
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper suggests that deliberate policies and programs designed to identify and promote specific places (or terroir) could favor expanded organic production and market development. Shared concepts and principals between organic and place-named production suggest that a more specific relationship built on organic and geographically-indicated products and practices might offer opportunities to set priorities and identify smart strategies for enhancing the promotion of organic.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Bingen, Jim and Freyer, Bernhard (2014) People, Place and Participation. Bringing Together Organic and Place - insights from Austria and the US. In: Building Organic Bridges, Johann Heinrich von Thünen-Institut, Braunschweig, Germany, 4, Thuenen Report, no. 20, pp. 1171-1174.
